text: New Boston (or Union CityOrth, Donald J. Dictionary of Alaska Place Names. Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1967.) was a historical populated place in Juneau, Alaska. It was located one mile west of the city of Juneau, on Douglas Island; according to R. N. DeArmond, it was a short-lived town. The name was collected in 1967 and entered into the Geographic Names Information System on March 23, 2001.USGS GNIS Feature Detail Report: New Boston ==References== Category:Populated coastal places in Alaska Category:Populated places in Juneau, Alaska
title: New Boston, Juneau
